verses.kjv: The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah king of Judah, that was the first year of Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon;
verses.ct: This message came to Jeremiah about all the people of Judah during the 4th year of King Jehoiakim son of Josiah, king of Judah — which was the 1st year of King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon.

verses.kjv: The which Jeremiah the prophet spake unto all the people of Judah, and to all the inhabitants of Jerusalem, saying,
verses.ct: Jeremiah the prophet delivered this message to all the people of Judah and everyone living in Jerusalem:

verses.kjv: From the thirteenth year of Josiah the son of Amon king of Judah, even unto this day, that is the three and twentieth year, the word of the LORD hath come unto me, and I have spoken unto you, rising early and speaking; but ye have not hearkened.
verses.ct: "For 23 years — from the 13th year of Josiah son of Amon, king of Judah, right up to today — the LORD has been giving me his word, and I have spoken it to you again and again. But you have refused to listen.

verses.kjv: And the LORD hath sent unto you all his servants the prophets, rising early and sending them; but ye have not hearkened, nor inclined your ear to hear.
verses.ct: The LORD has sent all his servants the prophets to you, time after time, but you have refused to listen or even pay attention.

verses.kjv: They said, Turn ye again now every one from his evil way, and from the evil of your doings, and dwell in the land that the LORD hath given unto you and to your fathers for ever and ever:
verses.ct: They told you, 'Each of you must turn away from your wicked behavior and your evil practices. Then you can keep living in the land that the LORD gave to you and your ancestors permanently.

verses.kjv: And go not after other gods to serve them, and to worship them, and provoke me not to anger with the works of your hands; and I will do you no hurt.
verses.ct: Don't chase after other gods, serving and worshiping them. Don't make me angry with the things your hands have made, and I won't bring disaster on you.'

verses.kjv: Yet ye have not hearkened unto me, saith the LORD; that ye might provoke me to anger with the works of your hands to your own hurt.
verses.ct: But you refused to listen to me," declares the LORD. "Instead, you provoked me with the things your hands made, bringing harm on yourselves."

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the LORD of hosts; Because ye have not heard my words,
verses.ct: So this is what the LORD of Hosts says: "Because you have not obeyed my words,

verses.kjv: Behold, I will send and take all the families of the north, saith the LORD, and Nebuchadrezzar the king of Babylon, my servant, and will bring them against this land, and against the inhabitants thereof, and against all these nations round about, and will utterly destroy them, and make them an astonishment, and an hissing, and perpetual desolations.
verses.ct: pay attention — I am going to summon all the peoples of the north," declares the LORD, "along with my servant King Nebuchadrezzar of Babylon. I will bring them against this land, against everyone living in it, and against all the surrounding nations. I will completely destroy them and turn them into an object of horror, of mockery, and of permanent ruin.

verses.kjv: Moreover I will take from them the voice of mirth, and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstones, and the light of the candle.
verses.ct: I will remove from them every sound of joy and celebration, the voices of the groom and the bride, the grinding of millstones, and the glow of lamps.

verses.kjv: And this whole land shall be a desolation, and an astonishment; and these nations shall serve the king of Babylon seventy years.
verses.ct: This entire land will become a horrifying wasteland, and these nations will serve the king of Babylon for 70 years.

verses.kjv: And it shall come to pass, when seventy years are accomplished, that I will punish the king of Babylon, and that nation, saith the LORD, for their iniquity, and the land of the Chaldeans, and will make it perpetual desolations.
verses.ct: When those 70 years are over, I will punish the king of Babylon and his nation for their sin," declares the LORD, "and I will turn the land of the Chaldeans into a permanent wasteland.

verses.kjv: And I will bring upon that land all my words which I have pronounced against it, even all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah hath prophesied against all the nations.
verses.ct: I will carry out against that land everything I have declared against it — everything recorded in this book that Jeremiah prophesied against all the nations.

verses.kjv: For many nations and great kings shall serve themselves of them also: and I will recompense them according to their deeds, and according to the works of their own hands.
verses.ct: Many nations and powerful kings will enslave them as well. I will repay them for what they have done and for the work of their own hands."

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD God of Israel unto me; Take the wine cup of this fury at my hand, and cause all the nations, to whom I send thee, to drink it.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, said to me: "Take this cup of wine representing my fury from my hand, and make every nation I send you to drink from it.

verses.kjv: And they shall drink, and be moved, and be mad, because of the sword that I will send among them.
verses.ct: They will drink it and stagger and go insane because of the warfare I am sending against them."

verses.kjv: Then took I the cup at the LORD’s hand, and made all the nations to drink, unto whom the LORD had sent me:
verses.ct: So I took the cup from the LORD's hand and made every nation drink from it — every nation the LORD had sent me to:

verses.kjv: To wit, Jerusalem, and the cities of Judah, and the kings thereof, and the princes thereof, to make them a desolation, an astonishment, an hissing, and a curse; as it is this day;
verses.ct: Jerusalem and the cities of Judah, along with their kings and officials, to turn them into a wasteland, an object of horror, mockery, and cursing — as they are today;

verses.kjv: Pharaoh king of Egypt, and his servants, and his princes, and all his people;
verses.ct: Pharaoh king of Egypt, his officials, his officers, and all his people;

verses.kjv: And all the mingled people, and all the kings of the land of Uz, and all the kings of the land of the Philistines, and Ashkelon, and Azzah, and Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod,
verses.ct: all the foreign residents there; all the kings of the land of Uz; all the kings of the Philistine territory — Ashkelon, Azzah, Ekron, and what remains of Ashdod;

verses.kjv: Edom, and Moab, and the children of Ammon,
verses.ct: Edom, Moab, and the people of Ammon;

verses.kjv: And all the kings of Tyrus, and all the kings of Zidon, and the kings of the isles which are beyond the sea,
verses.ct: all the kings of Tyrus, all the kings of Zidon, and the kings of the coastlands across the sea;

verses.kjv: Dedan, and Tema, and Buz, and all that are in the utmost corners,
verses.ct: Dedan, Tema, Buz, and all who live in remote regions;

verses.kjv: And all the kings of Arabia, and all the kings of the mingled people that dwell in the desert,
verses.ct: all the kings of Arabia and all the kings of the mixed peoples living in the desert;

verses.kjv: And all the kings of Zimri, and all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes,
verses.ct: all the kings of Zimri, all the kings of Elam, and all the kings of the Medes;

verses.kjv: And all the kings of the north, far and near, one with another, and all the kingdoms of the world, which are upon the face of the earth: and the king of Sheshach shall drink after them.
verses.ct: and all the kings of the north, near and far, one after another — every kingdom on the surface of the earth. And after all of them, the king of Sheshach will drink too.

verses.kjv: Therefore thou shalt say unto them, Thus saith the LORD of hosts, the God of Israel; Drink ye, and be drunken, and spue, and fall, and rise no more, because of the sword which I will send among you.
verses.ct: "Then tell them, 'This is what the LORD of Hosts, the God of Israel, says: Drink! Get drunk, vomit, collapse, and never get up again — because of the warfare I am sending against you.'

verses.kjv: And it shall be, if they refuse to take the cup at thine hand to drink, then shalt thou say unto them, Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Ye shall certainly drink.
verses.ct: If they refuse to take the cup from your hand and drink, tell them, 'This is what the LORD of Hosts says: You absolutely will drink it.

verses.kjv: For, lo, I begin to bring evil on the city which is called by my name, and should ye be utterly unpunished? Ye shall not be unpunished: for I will call for a sword upon all the inhabitants of the earth, saith the LORD of hosts.
verses.ct: Look — I am already bringing disaster on the city that bears my name. Do you really think you will escape punishment? You will not escape, because I am summoning warfare against everyone living on earth,'" declares the LORD of Hosts.

verses.kjv: Therefore prophesy thou against them all these words, and say unto them, The LORD shall roar from on high, and utter his voice from his holy habitation; he shall mightily roar upon his habitation; he shall give a shout, as they that tread the grapes, against all the inhabitants of the earth.
verses.ct: "So prophesy all these words against them and tell them: 'The LORD will roar from on high and thunder from his holy dwelling. He will roar powerfully over his land. He will shout like those who trample grapes, against everyone living on earth.

verses.kjv: A noise shall come even to the ends of the earth; for the LORD hath a controversy with the nations, he will plead with all flesh; he will give them that are wicked to the sword, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: The uproar will reach the ends of the earth, because the LORD has a case against the nations. He is bringing judgment on all humanity. The wicked will be handed over to the sword,'" declares the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts, Behold, evil shall go forth from nation to nation, and a great whirlwind shall be raised up from the coasts of the earth.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD of Hosts says: "Pay attention — disaster is spreading from nation to nation, and a massive storm is rising from the far corners of the earth."

verses.kjv: And the slain of the LORD shall be at that day from one end of the earth even unto the other end of the earth: they shall not be lamented, neither gathered, nor buried; they shall be dung upon the ground.
verses.ct: On that day, those killed by the LORD will stretch from one end of the earth to the other. No one will mourn for them, gather them up, or bury them. They will lie on the ground like dung.

verses.kjv: Howl, ye shepherds, and cry; and wallow yourselves in the ashes, ye principal of the flock: for the days of your slaughter and of your dispersions are accomplished; and ye shall fall like a pleasant vessel.
verses.ct: Wail, you leaders! Cry out! Roll in ashes, you heads of the flock! Your time for slaughter and scattering has arrived, and you will shatter like a fine piece of pottery.

verses.kjv: And the shepherds shall have no way to flee, nor the principal of the flock to escape.
verses.ct: The leaders will find no way to run, and the heads of the flock will have no escape.

verses.kjv: A voice of the cry of the shepherds, and an howling of the principal of the flock, shall be heard: for the LORD hath spoiled their pasture.
verses.ct: Listen to the leaders crying out, the heads of the flock wailing, because the LORD is destroying their pastureland.

verses.kjv: And the peaceable habitations are cut down because of the fierce anger of the LORD.
verses.ct: Their peaceful homes are being demolished because of the LORD's burning anger.

verses.kjv: He hath forsaken his covert, as the lion: for their land is desolate because of the fierceness of the oppressor, and because of his fierce anger.
verses.ct: Like a lion leaving its den, he has abandoned his place, because their land has become a wasteland due to the brutality of the oppressor and because of his burning anger.
